page.title: 14ECOLOGY OF WEST NOTTINGHAM.
page.content: {Deciduous woodland}at Tilbury, Broxtowe, High & Low Woods; latter two are smaller copses. {William Crane } campus noted for world-wide range of shrubs and trees. Several of the wider Boulevards (eg. ring road) tree-lined. Aspley Lane has {cherry trees }and occupiersare encouraged to maintain the tradition. 1985{Urban Fox Survey}carried out & several specimens sighted. {Footpaths}in North-Western part of area, crossing open land, close to woods & disused railway. Another leads thru' the large Aspley residential council estate (laid out radially around the William Crane campus, and an internationally acclaimed project at its completion) to stream & open land.{River Leen}polluted from factories:large spoilheap{Babbington {Colliery:}domestic dumping Tilbury wds
